i18n.title: Roadmap
i18n.intro:
Roadmap

This page outlines the history of Ethereum Classic and it's future development goals.
i18n.timeline:
ETC Timeline

A brief history of the events that created and defined Ethereum Classic
i18n.developmentPlans:
Development Plans for 2019-2020

Ethereum Classic (ETC) is a blockchain and Cryptocurrency that takes digitized value further. Rather than just allowing people to send value to each other ETC allows them to create more complex contracts between each other that operate autonomously.

The goal of ETC contributors is to make ETC ubiquitous across the world with developers integrating ETC blockchain wherever they need. This will ultimately allow users to effortlessly experience blockchain’s benefits.

Please be advised that following plan is subject to change. This plan is preliminary and reflects only major steps, during the year unexpected challenges may surface, or it may pivot to a more optimal direction. Minor releases, maintenance, and experimental projects are not reflected below

road.ethCompatibilityText: The EVM and SputnikVM will be updated to support the Byz + Const hard fork.
road.embeddedSvmText: Embedded SVM will allow EVM and SputnikVM for embedded applications.
road.documentationWebsiteText: A new documentation website will be provided to help new and existing developers. Embedded documentation in ETC tooling will be explored.
road.classicGethText: Support and maintenance for Classic Geth.
road.jsonRpcSchemaText: Create ECIP for automated JSON Schema generation from Classic-Geth and Multi-Geth. This will reduce operational costs related to libraries. This improvement would make the DApp development environment more efficient by removing the need for RPC APIs such as Web3 or Emerald JS.
road.serviceRunnerText: A Service Runner API would help make DApp framework dependencies and integrations easier manage.
road.dappDeploymentToolText: An easy to use GUI application for developers to deploy their DApps.
road.uxUiResearchText: Research will be performed to investigate the DApp development environment.
road.multiNetworkExplorerText: An easy to use block explorer for DApp development which can be used with any Ethereum based network.
road.etcJitCompilerText: The ETC JIT compiler will translate EVM byte-code to native machine code. The JIT compiler typically reduces program execution time by a factor of 3–4x.
road.atlantisHardForkText: Enable the outstanding Ethereum Foundation Spurious Dragon and Byzantium network protocol upgrades on the Ethereum Classic network
road.smartContractIdeText: An easy to use smart contract IDE and runtime environment.
road.multiGethText: Continuous support and maintenance for Multi-Geth.
road.evmLlvmBackendText: With an EVM backend target for LLVM, developers can use a large scope of programming languages other than Solidity to target the Ethereum Virtual Machine. An EVM backend target opens opportunities for source level debugging and exposes EVM interest to the LLVM community.
road.devTutorialsAndGuidesText: Continuous support new and existing developers with tutorials and guides.
road.aghartaHardForkText: Enable the outstanding Ethereum Foundation Constaninople and Petersburg network protocol upgrades on the Ethereum Classic network.
road.aztlNHardForkText: Enable the outstanding Ethereum Foundation Istanbul network protocol upgrades on the Ethereum Classic network.

timeline.helperText: Drag to progress (or hold shift and wheel)!
timeline.ethereumLaunchesText: Vitalik Buterin and The Ethereum Foundation create the first blockchain-based turing-complete smart contract platform
timeline.slockItCreatesTheDAOText: Slock.it construct TheDAO Ethereum Contract; a security audit is completed by Dejavu
timeline.theDAOCrowdsaleBeginsText: TheDAO smart contract is deployed; members of the public send it value in return for DAO tokens
timeline.securityProposalText: Slock.it announce a $1.5 Million USD proposal, paid in Ether by the crowdfund, 'to guarantee the integrity of The DAO'
timeline.moratoriumCalledText: On the last day of the crowdsale, DAO curator Vlad Zamfir calls for a moratorium on TheDAO, citing many game-theoretical security issues
timeline.theDAOCrowdsaleEndsText: The crowdsale completes to become the world's largest and raising an incredible $150 Million USD
timeline.recursiveCallBugDiscoveredText: Peter Vessenes publicly discloses the existence of a critical security vulnerability overlooked in many Solidiy contracts
timeline.noFundsAtRiskText: Stephan Tual publicly claims that TheDAO funds are safe despite the newly-discovered critical security flaw
timeline.theDAOIsHackedText: Ether is slowly and silently drained from TheDAO as the re-entry bug is applied
timeline.panicHitsTheMarketsText: The price of Ether is slashed in half as Griff Green announces that TheDAO has been hacked
timeline.theCountdownBeingsText: TheDAO's splitting mechanism gives around a month for a solution to be found that recovers the funds; Foundation and community developers race to implement a soft fork
timeline.robinHoodGroupAnnouncedText: A group of 'white-hat' hackers secure 70% of TheDAO funds but protocol-level action is required to save the remaining 30% split by the hacker
timeline.dAOWarsText: The Ethereum Foundation releases a 'Soft Fork' client to censor transactions coming from the hacker; mining pools vote to enable it by lowering gas limit
timeline.softForkVulnerabilityText: Critical Denial of Service flaws are found in the Soft Fork implementation, miners quickly decide not to use it
timeline.hardForkDebateText: Many days of intense arguing goes on in the Ethereum community about the pros and cons of implementing a Hard Fork
timeline.hardForkSpecAnnouncedText: The only remaining option is a controversial Hard Fork. A Specification is determined and announced by Slock.it and Ethereum Foundation members
timeline.lastMinuteCarbonvoteText: With 12 hours notice, The Ethereum Foundation use a controversial third party 'coin vote' to determine that the Hard Fork should be turned on by default; consensus is declared and an updated client is released
timeline.dAOBailoutHardForkText: With around 80% of nodes updating to the new client, the community nervously await the arrival of the Hard Fork activation block 1920000
timeline.missionAccomplishedText: The community lets out a sigh of relief as the Hard Fork code is succesfully implemented with no obvious flaws; champagne corks are popped all over the globe
timeline.ethereumClassicIsBornText: With predictions of the original non-forked chain to disappear within hours, many are surprised to find that miners continue mining blocks and OTC trading of the original chain tokens gives them value
timeline.poloniexListsETCText: The largest Ethereum exchange lists 'ETC' - Ethereum Classic; many exchanges quickly follow suit, ETC price peaks to 1/3 of ETH's
timeline.communityInDisarrayText: Flame wars begin in the once peaceful /r/Ethereum and /r/ethtrader subreddits and economically-charged vitriolic spats begin to take hold of the community as it comes to terms with the split
timeline.ethereumClassicCommunityText: The Ethereum Classic community begins to branch off from the forked-chain subreddits and form its own communication channels, including /r/EthereumClassic, Slack and Telegram
timeline.rHGStrikesBackText: The Robin Hood Group attempts to dump a large quantity of stolen ETC on the market. Poloniex freezes the funds. Uncertainty reaches an all time high.
timeline.classicDeclaresIndependenceiceText: Declaration of Independence on the ETC website is published stating ETC no longer wants to be in association with the Foundation.
timeline.classicRebuildsText: The Ethereum Classic community begins to rally behind a stabilizing ETC price by rebuilding on the Classic network; this website is created, groups are formed, new ideas begin to surface
timeline.dAOETCUnlockedText: Millions of previously locked or frozen ETC become available to DAO token holders and DAO attacker. Despite predictions of doom and gloom, ETC price holds remarkably well in face of huge dumps
timeline.attacksAndUpgradesText: Both Ethereums are hit with non-stop network attacks; ETC devs quickly ensure smooth and uncontentious network upgrade to patch exploited vulnerabilities
timeline.etcMonetaryPolicyText: Classic community starts debating ETC monetary policy and emission schedule, as a way to align interests of platform users, miners, investors and developers
timeline.grothendieckTeamText: A team of 7 full-time developers, committed by IOHK, starts working for Ethereum Classic
timeline.etcDiehardUpgradeText: ETC goes through a non-contentious network upgrade, resolving critical issues such as difficulty bomb and replay attacks
timeline.etcDEVTeamAnnouncementText: A team of long-term ETC contributors and volunteers rebrands as a ETCDEV team
timeline.monetaryPolicyAdoptedText: Ethereum Classic community adopts a fixed-cap monetary policy with a Bitcoin-like limited emission schedule
timeline.etcInvestmentFundText: Grayscale circulates investment thesis for 'Ethereum (ETC) Investment Trust', first non-bitcoin crypto fund targeted at traditional investors
timeline.toBeContinuedText: As Ethereum Classic community and its two independent dev teams start to focus efforts on development and applications, we look forward to ETC becoming a decentralized immutable public infrastructure of the future...
